alert.note: Alert for Cuyahoga; Geauga; Lake; Portage; Summit (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following counties, Cuyahoga, Geauga, Lake, Portage and Summit. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 830 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 0.8 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cleveland, Akron, Painesville, Willowick, Chardon, Fairport Harbor, Parma, Cuyahoga Falls, Euclid, Mentor, Cleveland Heights, Kent, Solon, Willoughby, Hudson, Twinsburg, Eastlake, Tallmadge, Streetsboro and Warrensville Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
